description: From New Latin syphilis, originally the title of a poem by Girolamo Fracastoro concerning “Syphilus”,  a shepherd boy who insulted the Greek god Apollo and was punished by that god with a horrible disease.

entries.meaning: (pathology) A disease spread via sexual activity, caused by the bacterium Treponema pallidum.
examples: Synonyms: (dated) Cupid's disease, (obsolete) great-pox, (dated) French disease, French gout, French pox, ladies' fever, leprosy, lues, lues venerea, syph
